[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@here/harp-mapview](./harp-mapview.md) &gt; [IMapRenderingManager](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.md)

## IMapRenderingManager interface

The `MapRenderingManager` class manages the map rendering (as opposed to text) by dispatching the \[\[MapRenderingManager.render\]\] call to a set of internal \[\[Pass\]\] instances. It provides an API to modify some of the rendering processes like the antialiasing behaviour at runtime.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface IMapRenderingManager extends IPassManager 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [bloom](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.bloom.md) | [IBloomEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.ibloomeffect.md) | Bloom effect parameters. |
|  [dynamicMsaaSamplingLevel](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.dynamicmsaasamplinglevel.md) | [MSAASampling](./harp-mapview.msaasampling.md) | The level of MSAA sampling while the user interacts. It should be a low level so that the MSAA does not impact the framerate. |
|  [lowResPixelRatio](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.lowrespixelratio.md) | number | Set a <code>pixelRatio</code> for dynamic rendering (i.e. during animations). If a value is specified, the <code>LowResRenderPass</code> will be employed to used to render the scene into a lower resolution render target, which will then be rendered to the screen. |
|  [msaaEnabled](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.msaaenabled.md) | boolean | Enable or disable the MSAA. If disabled, <code>MapRenderingManager</code> will use the renderer provided in the \[\[MapRenderingManager.render\]\] method to render the scene. |
|  [outline](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.outline.md) | [IOutlineEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.ioutlineeffect.md) | Outline effect parameters. |
|  [sepia](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.sepia.md) | [ISepiaEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.isepiaeffect.md) | Sepia effect parameters. |
|  [staticMsaaSamplingLevel](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.staticmsaasamplinglevel.md) | [MSAASampling](./harp-mapview.msaasampling.md) | The higher level of MSAA sampling for a last frame to render, when the camera is static. It can be a high level, providing high quality renders requiring few tens of seconds, since no frame is expected to immediately follow in the requestAnimationFrame. It is still limited by zooming, since zooming is not requestAnimationFrame-based and can lead to stuttering if the render time is too long, except on desktop Mac, where mouse interaction already implements some damping. Higher levels of sampling may lead to noticeable color banding, visible in areas with a slight color gradient, like large areas or the sky background. |
|  [vignette](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.vignette.md) | [IVignetteEffect](./harp-datasource-protocol.ivignetteeffect.md) | Vignette effect parameters. |

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [render(renderer, scene, camera, isStaticFrame, time)](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.render.md) | The method to call to render the map. This method depends on an <code>isStaticFrame</code> boolean that notifies the pass manager to switch to a higher level render quality for the last frame. |
|  [updateOutline(options)](./harp-mapview.imaprenderingmanager.updateoutline.md) | Updating the outline rebuilds the outline materials of every outlined mesh. |
